13306965.projn:
AR-Provincial Agricultural Development
            Project - Loan 4150 -- P006010
13306965.subsc: Central government administration,Sub-natl govt admin,Gen agr/fish/for sec,Water supply
13306965.theme: Rural policies and institutions,Other rural development,Rural services and infrastructure
13306965.trustfund:
TF032452-ARGENTINA - AGRICULTURE,TF023027-PHRD-PROVINCIAL AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT,TF032731-ARGENTINA - PROVENCIAL
            AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF033090-ARGENTINA - PROVINCIAL
            AGRICULTURAL DEV. PROJ,TF033134-ARGENTINA - AGRICULTURE,TF032451-ARGENTINA - AGRICULTURE

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Provincial Agricultural
            Development Project for Argentina were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory; risk to development outcome was:
            moderate; Bank performance was moderately satisfactory;
            borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned includes: a pre-defined and well-prepared
            portfolio of investments ready for implementation remains
            prudent, and can mitigate the tendency for innovative
            difficult projects to absorb much time in the early years in
            'learning by doing' but not disbursing. Leveraging
            maximum impact from resources allocated for subprojects
            requires the identification of investment proposals in a
            transparent, strategic and participatory manner, promoting
            competition for support through targeting mechanisms which
            ensure high quality, sustainable subproject proposals
            consistent with project development objectives and sector
            priorities. Capacity-building at the provincial level must
            be tailored to the unique technical, institutional and
            financial endowments of each province, avoid standardized
            training and technical assistance of uneven relevance and
            utility, and adopt both demand and supply-driven approaches.
            Complex, difficult operations in the rural sector with long
            lead times and a high degree of innovation require an
            extended horizon, continuous support for progressive
            capacity building and repeat financing to maximize impact,
            learning and sustainability. Private sector actors in the
            agro industrial sector and producers should not be assumed
            capable of responding on their own to public Investments in
            rural infrastructure and services. Project investments are
            necessary to stimulate private investment but not sufficient
            to guarantee further investment especially if financial
            resources and lines of credit are unavailable or
            inaccessible. Evaluation results from irrigation subprojects
            in Mendoza province suggest that further, comprehensive
            interventions are needed to increase provincial
            competitiveness in open global markets.

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Additional Financing for the
            Provincial Agricultural Development Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Additional
            Financing (AF) for the Provincial Agricultural Development
            Project for Argentina are: to increase and diversify
            agricultural production and exports through intensifying
            land use, increasing productivity per hectare, and
            introducing new crops and modern varieties; and to increase
            and stabilize the agricultural incomes of about 120,000
            small and medium-sized commercial farms. The approval of the
            AF was based on the good performance of the original loan
            over the past few years, and to cover a financing gap of
            ongoing activities while the Bank and the Government of
            Argentina (GoA) conducted a dialogue regarding a second
            phase of the project. The reallocation is necessary to
            accommodate the larger than expected costs for works, and
            expenditures in consultant's and non-consultant
            services and training (due to the extension of the project
            closing date in 2008 by 18 months), by lowering the
            allocation for goods and recurrent costs.

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Programa de Servicios Agricolas
            Provinciales (PROSAP) : informe ambiental (version preliminar)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Provincial Agricultural Development
            Project is part of the modernization and decentralization
            efforts of the public administration which are being
            executed by the Government and the Provincial
            Administration.  Its main objective is to improve
            economically and environmentally the agro-fishery public
            services of the provinces, within the framework of a
            strategy of competitive production for internal and external
            markets.  This report contains a summary of the
            environmental impacts, both positive and negative, of the
            project on: 1) water resources; 2) vegetation; 3) livestock;
            4) neighboring roads; 5) land titling; 6) technology; and 7)
            water systems improvement.  The report also presents a brief
            description of the project and its components, as well as
            the general framework of its environmental assessment.
            Finally, the report reviews ways to mitigate the negative
            impacts of the project.

display_title.display_title:
Argentina - Programa de Servicios
            Agrícolas Provinciales (PROSAP): Informe ambiental (versión
            preliminar) (Vol. 2) : Informe final

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Provincial Agricultural
            Development Project : indigenous peoples plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The main development objective of the
            Provincial Agricultural Development Project (PROSAP) for
            Argentina is to increase and diversify agricultural
            production and exports. This Indigenous Peoples Plan (IPP) /
            Diagnostico socio-economico y cultural de la colonia
            aborigen Chaco : plan de desarrollo indígena, evaluated
            impacts as follows : land acquisition and social assessment
            policies and practices; evaluated indigenous peoples (IPs)in
            the area of influence of the project, reviewed their
            cultural heritage and established guidelines that will
            ensure that their rights, including their dignity and
            cultural identity are respected; traditional forms of
            leadership among the indigenous organizations; sanitary
            installations; ethnics relations among IPs and criollos;
            loss of fishing and hunting sources; loss of pastures and
            vegetation; schools and health facilities; deterioration of
            feeder roads and bridges. This IPP document recommends
            mitigation measures as follows : guarantee indigenous
            peoples participation throughout the implementation and
            monitoring of the project; executing agencies will respect
            cultural and religious sites; government, local institutions
            and consultants working for these institutions will include
            indigenous peoples (IPs) in all activities of the project,
            including preparation, design, execution and evaluation of
            subprojects; organize community awareness campaigns to
            inform IPs progress of project implementation; promote a
            participatory approach among rural indigenous communities;
            develop an institutional strengthening plan for the
            indigenous organizations and the ethnics groups within the
            (Colonia Aborigen Chaco)) the area of influence of the
            project; establish a system to monitor the quality of
            drinking water; and finally, propose an implementation plan
            for better communication and dissemination of information
            between the Provincial Estate government and the indigenous organizations.
